page.title: 01THE COUNTRYSIDE
page.content: This block lies in undulating country between the Quantock Hills and the Bristol Channel. 90% of the area is farmland mainly intensively managed grassland but with an increasing acreage of other crops, especially cereals and oil seed rape. There are also some small areas of mixed deciduous woodland. With the exception of the village of Storgursey, settlement is mainly in the form of small hamlets and scattered farms. There are two large intensive rearing poultry units and a french-owned intensive calf rearing unit. The village of Stogursey lies in the extreme S.W. of the block. The population is about 1500. Local facilities include post office, primary school, garage, butcher, newsagent, baker, hairdresser, two general stores and two public houses.
